name: Chalchiuhtlicue
credit: Artist unknown, photo by FA2010 / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: Chalchiuhtlicue released 52 years of rain, destroying the old world and making way for the current one.
ability_text: When this goddess is invoked, she may choose an opposing entity to make a defense roll. If that roll is less than 11, that entity is defeated.

name: Chicomecōātl
credit: Artist unknown, photo by FA2010 / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: Chicomecōātl is known as "goddess of nourishment", and is an agricultural goddess associated with corn.
ability_text: When this goddess is invoked, she may give any or all of her energy points to her supporting entities.

name: Cihuacóatl
credit: Artist unknown, ca. 600-900, photo by Vassil / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: Cihuacóatl is a motherhood and fertility goddess who has often been associated with midwives.
ability_text: When this goddess is invoked, she may summon a Cihuātēotl creature. This goddess cannot be attacked while she is supported by a Cihuacoatl.

name: Coatlicue
credit: Artist unknown, photo copyright Rob Young / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: Coatlicue gave birth to the moon and stars when her children fought a vicious war amongst each other.
ability_text: When this goddess is invoked, and before the start of each round, she may roll 1 die. If the roll is even, she may choose an opposing faction, and give -1 Power to all of the entities in that faction until the end of the round.

name: Huehuetéotl
credit: Artist unknown, photo copyright Rosemania / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: Toxiuhmolpilia means "the tying of the years", and is a ritual of rebirth performed every 52 years.
ability_text: When this god is invoked, and at the start of each round, this god may clash with an opposing entity. When this god wins a clash, he may give -1 Attack to the losing entity until the end of the round.

name: Huitzilopochtli
flavor: Some Aztec warriors used a weapon called an "atlatl" to hurl large wooden spears.
ability_text: Once per round when a supporting entity makes an attack, this god may make an attack.

name: Mictecacihuatl
flavor: As the goddess of the underworld, Mictecacihuatl is said to watch over the bones of the dead.
ability_text: Empower: This goddess may choose an opposing entity, and force that entity to make a defense roll. If that roll is less than 11, this goddess may remove up to 2 energy points from that entity.

name: Mictlantecuhtli
credit: Artist unknown, photo copyright Anagoria / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: The Aztec underworld is named Mictlan, and is presided over by Mictlantecuhtli and Mictecacihuatl.
ability_text: When this god is invoked, and at the start of each round, he may clash with an opposing entity. When this god wins a clash, he may remove an energy point from the losing entity.

name: Quetzalcóatl
flavor: The priests of Quetzalcóatl each wore a talisman called an ehecaicozcatl, which means "wind jewel".
ability_text: Once per round after a supporting entity makes an attack and hits, if the attack roll was even, that entity may make an additional attack.

name: Tezcatlipōca
flavor: One of Tezcatlipōca's epithets is Ilhuicahua Tlalticpaque, "Possessor of the Sky and Earth"
ability_text: When this god is invoked, he may replace this ability with any supporting entity's ability.

name: Tlālōc
flavor: One of Tlālōc's names, Tlamacazqui, means "giver", and is also the word for "priest" in Nahuatl.
ability_text: This god gets +1 Defense for each supporting entity with {WATER}.

name: Xiuhtecuhtli
credit: Artist unknown, photo copyright Anagoria / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: Xiuhtecuhtli is called "Turquoise Lord", and Xiuhuitzolli is his turquoise crown of rulership.
ability_text: When this god makes an attack, the attack roll gets +1 for each counter on the defending entity.

name: Amun
credit: Artist unknown, 14th century BCE, photo copyright Janmad / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: Amun was the patron deity of the city of Thebes, and came to be known as "King of the Gods".
ability_text: When this god is invoked, he may choose an opposing faction. When he does, one of the entities in the chosen faction must make a defense roll. If that roll is less than 11, this god may remove up to 2 energy points from each entity within that faction.

name: Anubis
flavor: Anubis is involved in the "Weighing of the Heart", a ceremony which decides a soul's final fate.
ability_text: Whenever a supporting entity is removed from the battle, this god may clash with the removing entity. If this god wins that clash, he may remove up to 2 energy points from the removing entity.

name: Hathor
credit: Artist unknown, photo copyright Andres Rueda / Flickr.
flavor: Mehturt means "great flood", a term associated with the annual flooding of the Nile river.
ability_text: This god may give +1 Defense to all supporting entities.

name: Horus
flavor: Har-Wer means "Horus the Great", so-named because of his victories over his uncle, Set.
ability_text: After this god makes an attack and hits, he may clash with an opposing entity. Once per round when this god wins a clash, he may immediately make an attack.

name: Isis
flavor: Isis is called Weret-Hekau, or "great enchantress", and is the patroness of magic.
ability_text: When this goddess is invoked, and at the start of each round, this goddess may choose an opposing entity and clash with it. When this goddess wins a clash, she may give an energy point to any supporting entity.

name: Osiris
credit: Artist unknown, ca. 1300 BCE, facsimile by E. A. Wallis Budge.
flavor: Osiris's body was torn to pieces by his brother, Set, but he was bandaged back together by his wife, Isis.
ability_text: This god cannot lose energy points or be removed from the battle without making a defense roll.

name: Ra
flavor: Ra created each form of life by speaking their secret names, thus calling them into existence.
ability_text: When this god is invoked, he may summon a Sphinx creature. This god cannot be attacked while he is supported by a Sphinx.

name: Seker
credit: Artist unknown, ca. 1300 BCE, facsimile by E. A. Wallis Budge.
flavor: Seker is a protector of tombs, and is called Lord of the Hallowed Land, or necropolis.
ability_text: When this god is invoked, he may return any defeated entity to the battle, and then this god is automatically defeated. When an entity is returned this way, that entity becomes part of this god's faction.

name: Sekhmet
flavor: Sekhmet is a warrior goddess who was seen as the protector of the pharaohs.
ability_text: Each round, this goddess may give +2 to the first attack roll made by a supporting entity.

name: Set
credit: Artist unknown, ca. 1254 BCE, photo by Chipdawes / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: Set is known as a god of the desert, as well as a god of storms, disorder, and violence.
ability_text: Empower: This god may clash with an opposing entity. If this god wins that clash, roll a die, and remove that many energy points from the losing entity.

name: Taweret
flavor: Taweret is a goddess of childbirth and fertility whose name literally means "she who is great".
ability_text: When this goddess is invoked, and before the start of each round, she may roll 1 die. If the roll is even, she may give +1 to the defense rolls made by all of the entities in her faction until the end of the round.

name: Wadjet
flavor: Wadjet sent fire to protect Ra, and thus became known as the "Lady of Flame".
ability_text: Whenever a supporting entity makes an attack, if the attacking entity shares an element with the defending entity, this goddess may give +2 to the attack roll.

name: Aphrodite
flavor: Despite being a goddess of love, her epithet Apaturus refers to her as "the deceptive one".
ability_text: Empower: This goddess may force any entity to attack any other entity.

name: Apollo
flavor: Apollo's skill with a bow is so great that he is called Argyrotoxus, which means "with silver bow".
ability_text: When a supporting entity makes an attack roll, that entity may roll an additional die and take the highest number among dice rolled.

name: Ares
flavor: Enualios means "the warlike", and refers to Ares' position as the chief Greek god of war.
ability_text: When this god makes an attack and hits, he removes an energy point from a supporting entity, if possible.

name: Artemis
credit: Artist unknown, 4th century, photo copyright Giovanni Dall'Orto / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: Artemis is the Greek goddess of hunting, and is known as Agrotera, which means "the huntress".
ability_text: Whenever an opposing entity clashes with a supporting entity, this goddess may give -1 to the opposing entity's clash roll.

name: Athena
credit: Antiochos, 1st century BCE, photo by Marie-Lan Nguyen / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: When Athena enters into a fight, she is known as Promachos, or "joiner of battles".
ability_text: When this goddess is invoked or returns to the battle, she may choose an element. She gives +1 Attack and -1 Defense to all of the entities in the battle that have the chosen element.

name: Demeter
flavor: Demeter is a harvest goddess, and is called Carpophorus, which means "the fruit-bearer".
ability_text: At the end of each round, this goddess may clash with an opposing entity. When this goddess wins a clash, she may give a Feast counter to a supporting entity. At the start of each round, this goddess may give one energy point to each supporting entity for each feast counter it has.

name: Hephaestus
credit: Guillaume Coustou the Younger, 1742, photo by Marie-Lan Nguyen / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: Hephaestus's skill at forging lead to him being called Clytotechnes, which means "famed for crafts".
ability_text: When either this god or a supporting entity is attacked, this god may give -1 to the attack roll.

name: Hera
credit: Artist unknown, 2nd century, photo by Marie-Lan Nguyen / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: Hera raised the many-headed Hydra Lernaia to slay the Greek hero Heracles, but he killed it instead.
ability_text: When this goddess is invoked, she may summon a Hydra creature. This goddess cannot be attacked while she is supported by a Hydra.

name: Hermes
flavor: As a god of athletics and games, Hermes is known as Promachus, meaning "champion".
ability_text: Once per round when this god makes an attack, he may make an additional attack.

name: Hestia
credit: Artist unknown, photo by Daderot / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: Hestia was worshipped by the civil leaders of ancient Greece, who called her Boulaia, or "of the council".
ability_text: When this goddess is invoked, and at the start of each round, this goddess may clash with an opposing entity. When this goddess wins a clash, all supporting entities get +1 Attack for the rest of the round.

name: Poseidon
flavor: As a strong-willed god of the oceans, Poseidon is called Taureos, or "bull of the sea".
ability_text: When a supporting entity makes an attack, the defending entity gets -1 Defense until the end of the round, to a maximum of -2.

name: Zeus
flavor: Zeus is called Brontios, or "Thunderer," because he is god of both the sky and thunderstorms.
ability_text: When this god is invoked, he may choose an opposing faction. When he does, one of the entities in the chosen faction must clash with this god. If this god wins that clash, he may remove up to 2 energy points from each entity within that faction.

name: Amaterasu
flavor: The Yasakani no Magatama is Amaterasu's jeweled necklace, now one of Japan's Imperial Regalia.
ability_text: When either this goddess or a supporting entity makes an attack, this goddess may give +1 to the attack roll for each counter on the defending entity.

name: Benzaiten
credit: Artist unknown, 13th century, photo by Daderot / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: The Nyoi Hōju is a magic jewel carried by Benzaiten which grants wishes and pacifies desires.
ability_text: Once per round when a supporting entity makes a die roll, this goddess may roll a die. When she does, this goddess may then replace the entity's die roll with that roll.

name: Bishamonten
credit: Artist unknown, 15th century, photo by Miguelwang2010 / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: As a protector of holy places, Bishamonten is called Tamonten, or "listening to many teachings".
ability_text: When this god is attacked and the attack hits, the attacking entity removes 1 less energy point from him, to a minimum of 1.

name: Fūjin
flavor: Fūjin holds a bag of wind over his shoulder which he used to clear out the primordial mists of the world.
ability_text: When this god makes an attack or defense roll, he may roll an additional die and take the highest number among dice rolled.

name: Izanagi
flavor: Izanagi raised the mythical island of Onogoro-shima with his "heavenly jeweled spear", Amenonuhoko.
ability_text: When this god attacks an entity with {LAW} or {CHAOS}, his attack roll gets +2. When this god is attacked by an entity with {LAW} or {CHAOS}, his defense roll gets +1.

name: Izanami
flavor: Izanami rules Yomi, the land of the dead, and is called Yomotsu ōkami, "Grand Deity of Yomi."
ability_text: When this goddess is invoked, she may clash with an opposing entity. If this goddess wins that clash, the opposing entity is defeated.

name: Jurōjin
flavor: Jurōjin's staff has a scroll tied to it, upon which is written the lifespan of all living things.
ability_text: This god may give +1 Power to all supporting entities.

name: Oinari
flavor: Oinari is the god of worldly success, or goukaku, and is commonly associated with foxes.
ability_text: Once per round after a supporting entity makes an attack and hits, this god may clash with an opposing entity. If this god wins that clash, the supporting entity may make an additional attack.

name: Raijin
flavor: Raijin is a god of lightning, thunder, and storms, and is accompanied by his companion, Raiju.
ability_text: When this god is invoked, he may summon a Raiju creature. This god cannot be attacked while he is supported by a Raiju.

name: Ryūjin
flavor: Ryūjin is a dragon god of the sea, and lives in an underwater castle known as Ryūgū-jō.
ability_text: When this god is invoked, and at the start of each round, he may clash with an opposing entity. When this god wins a clash, the losing entity gets -1 Defense for the rest of the round.

name: Shōki
flavor: Shōki is known as "Demon Queller" because he vowed to protect an emperor against evil demons.
ability_text: While there is an opposing creature in play, this god may give +1 Attack to all supporting entities.

name: Susanoo
flavor: Susanoo's sword was called Amenohabakiri, which means "Snake-Slayer of Takamagahara".
ability_text: Each round, this god may give +2 to the first defense roll made by a supporting entity.

name: Baldr
flavor: Baldr is called the "wisest of the Æsir", or vitrastr ása, and is known for his purity.
ability_text: Whenever either this god or a supporting entity is attacked, if the attacking entity shares an element with the defending entity, this god may give the defense roll a +2.

name: Freyja
flavor: Brisingamen was a special necklace that had been lost by Freyja, before being found by Heimdallr.
ability_text: When this goddess is attacked and the attack misses, she may give an energy point to any supporting entity.

name: Frigg
flavor: Frigg is said to spin the clouds from her bejeweled distaff, Friggerock.
ability_text: Once per round when an opposing entity makes a die roll, this goddess may force that entity to replace that die roll with another.

name: Freyr
flavor: Freyr is the owner of the Skíðblaðnir, attested to be the best ship ever created.
ability_text: Once per round before a supporting entity would be attacked, this god may change the target of that attack to be another supporting entity.

name: Heimdallr
flavor: Heimdallr's castle was called Himinbjörg, or "heaven's castle".
ability_text: When this god is invoked, and at the start of each round, this god may choose a supporting entity. The first time that the chosen entity makes an attack during that round, that entity may make an additional attack.

name: Hel
flavor: Hel's eating-knife is called Sultr, a term which denotes her insatiable greed.
ability_text: Empower: This goddess may give a Famine counter to an opposing entity, and roll one die. If the roll is even, she may give an additional famine counter to a different opposing entity. At the start of each round, this goddess may remove one energy point from each opposing entity for each famine counter it has.

name: Iðunn
credit: H.W. Bissen, 1858, photo by Daderot / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: Iðunnar Epla means "Iðunn's apples", and refers to magic apples which could grant eternal youth.
ability_text: This goddess may give +1 Power to all supporting entities.

name: Loki
flavor: Loki is known as Bölvasmiðr, or "mischief-maker", because he is a shape-shifting liar and thief.
ability_text: When this god is invoked, and before the start of each round, he may roll one die. If the die roll is even, all opposing entities get -1 Defense until the end of the round. If the roll is odd, all supporting entities get +1 Attack until the end of the round.

name: Óðin
flavor: The Valkyries are Odin's beautiful battle maidens, and are called Óðins Meyjar, or "Óðin's maids".
ability_text: When this god is invoked, he may summon a Valkyrie creature. This god cannot be attacked while he is supported by a Valkyrie.

name: Skaði
flavor: Skaði is called Öndurdís, or "(she) of the snow shoe", because she is associated with winter and hunting.
ability_text: Once per round when an entity makes a roll, this goddess may give -1 to that roll.

name: Sól
flavor: The goddess Sól drives a sun-chariot named Álfröðull, which means "elf disc".
ability_text: When this goddess makes an attack roll, she may use her current energy point total as her Attack score. This goddess may never have more than 9 energy points.

name: Thor
flavor: Thor's hammer can level mountains, and is called Mjölnir, or "that which smashes".
ability_text: Once per round after this god makes an attack, if the attack roll was even, he may make an additional attack.

name: Bau
credit: Artist unknown, ca. 2150 BCE, photo copyright Marie-Lan Nguyen / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: A goddess of fertility and healing, Bau was the patron deity of the city of Lagash.
ability_text: When this goddess makes an attack and the attack hits, she may give an energy point to any supporting entity.

name: Enki
flavor: Enki is called the lord of the Abzu, the groundwater located within the earth.
ability_text: When this god makes a defense roll, he may use his current energy point total as his Defense score. This god may never have more than 9 energy points.

name: Enlil
flavor: Anzû is a servant of the chief sky god Enlil, and guards the throne in Enlil's sanctuary.
ability_text: When this god is invoked, he may summon an Anzû creature. This god cannot be attacked while he is supported by Anzû.

name: Ereškigal
credit: Artist unknown, 1800-1750 BCE, photo by BabelStone / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: Ereškigal was tricked into forever ruling the netherworld by her sister, Inanna.
ability_text: When this goddess is attacked and the attack misses, she may remove a number of energy points from the attacking entity equal to the difference between the defense and attack rolls.

name: Inanna
credit: Artist unknown, ca. 300 BCE - 300 AD, photo by Marie-Lan Nguyen / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: Called the "Lady of Heaven", Inanna is a goddess of love, fertility, and warfare.
ability_text: When either this goddess or a supporting entity makes an attack and the defending entity has at least one counter on it, this goddess may give +1 to the attack roll.

name: Iškur
flavor: Iškur is the god of rain and thunder, responsible both for watering the crops and flooding the land.
ability_text: When this god is invoked or returns to the battle, he may choose an element. Once per round when a supporting entity with chosen element makes an attack, that entity may make an additional attack.

name: Nanãya
credit: Artist unknown, ca. 1186-1172 BCE, photo by Jastrow / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: Nanãya is a goddess of love and sensuality known for her great physical beauty.
ability_text: Empower: This goddess may choose an opposing entity, and force that entity to make a defense roll. If that roll is less than 11, this goddess may roll a die and remove up to that many energy points from the chosen entity.

name: Narundi
credit: Artist unknown, ca. 2100 BCE, photo copyright Marie-Lan Nguyen / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: Narundi, the goddess of victory, crushed all who opposed her.
ability_text: When an opposing entity is defeated, this goddess gets +1 Attack for the rest of the battle.

name: Ningal
flavor: Ningal was the Goddess of Reeds, which were used to construct huts, rafts, and baskets.
ability_text: When this goddess is invoked, she may give up to 4 total energy points to her supporting entities.

name: Ninsumun
credit: Artist unknown, photo by Marie-Lan Nguyen / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: Ninsumun is a goddess of motherhood, as well as the mother of the hero Gilgamesh.
ability_text: When an opposing entity's ability would modify a supporting entity's Defense score, this goddess may prevent that ability from modifying that score.

name: Ninurta
credit: Artist unknown, ca. 2700 BCE, photo by Marie-Lan Nguyen / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: Ninurta was known for using his magic mace, Sharur, which could take the form of a winged lion.
ability_text: When this god makes an attack and hits, he may give -1 Defense to the defending entity for the rest of the round.

name: Utu
credit: Artist unknown, 17th Century BCE, photo copyright Mbzt / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: As the god of justice, Utu descends into the underworld each night to decide the fate of the dead.
ability_text: When this god attacks an entity with {CHAOS}, the attack roll gets +2. When this god is attacked by an entity with {CHAOS}, the defense roll gets +1.

name: Cihuātēotl
flavor: The Cihuātēo, or "Celestial Princesses", were the spirits of Aztec women who died in childbirth.
ability_text: Once per round, when this creature removes at least one energy point from an opposing entity, she may give an energy point to a supporting entity.

name: Sphinx
credit: Artist unknown, ca. 1479–1458 BCE, photo by Oh Paris / Flickr.
flavor: The Sphinx is known as a guardian, and is often depicted protecting the entrances of sacred places.
ability_text: When an opposing entity's ability would modify the defense roll of an entity in this faction, this creature may prevent that modification from occurring.

name: Hydra
flavor: As Heracles fought the Hydra, he found that for each head he cut off, it grew two more.
ability_text: When this entity makes an attack, the defending entity's defense roll gets -1 for each energy point this creature has lost, to a maximum of -4.

name: Raiju
flavor: A Raiju is a being of pure lightning that scratches at trees as it flies about, and gives a cry like thunder.
ability_text: Empower: This creature may choose up to 2 opposing entities, and force them to each make a defense roll. If either entity's roll is less than 11, this creature may remove 1 energy point from each one.

name: Valkyrie
flavor: Gunnr is a Valkyrie, or "chooser of the slain", whose name means "battle".
ability_text: This creature gets +1 Attack for each supporting entity with {FIRE}.

name: Anzû
flavor: Anzu once stole the Tablet of Destinies from his master, Enlil, in a bid to control fate.
ability_text: Once per round when this creature makes an attack, if there is at least one other entity with {AIR} in the battle, this creature may make an additional attack.

name: Chalchiuhtlicue
credit: Artist unknown, photo by FA2010 / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: Chalchiuhtlicue released 52 years of rain, destroying the old world and making way for the current one.
ability_text: When this goddess is invoked, she may choose an opposing entity to make a defense roll. If that roll is less than 11, that entity is defeated.

name: Mictecacihuatl
flavor: As the goddess of the underworld, Mictecacihuatl is said to watch over the bones of the dead.
ability_text: Empower: This goddess may choose an opposing entity, and force that entity to make a defense roll. If that roll is less than 11, this goddess may remove up to 2 energy points from that entity.

name: Mictlantecuhtli
credit: Artist unknown, photo copyright Anagoria / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: The Aztec underworld is named Mictlan, and is presided over by Mictlantecuhtli and Mictecacihuatl.
ability_text: When this god is invoked, and at the start of each round, he may clash with an opposing entity. When this god wins a clash, he may remove an energy point from the losing entity.

name: Horus
flavor: Har-Wer means "Horus the Great", so-named because of his victories over his uncle, Set.
ability_text: After this god makes an attack and hits, he may clash with an opposing entity. Once per round when this god wins a clash, he may immediately make an attack.

name: Sekhmet
flavor: Sekhmet is a warrior goddess who was seen as the protector of the pharaohs.
ability_text: Each round, this goddess may give +2 to the first attack roll made by a supporting entity.

name: Apollo
flavor: Apollo's skill with a bow is so great that he is called Argyrotoxus, which means "with silver bow".
ability_text: When a supporting entity makes an attack roll, that entity may roll an additional die and take the highest number among dice rolled.

name: Hephaestus
credit: Guillaume Coustou the Younger, 1742, photo by Marie-Lan Nguyen / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: Hephaestus's skill at forging lead to him being called Clytotechnes, which means "famed for crafts".
ability_text: When either this god or a supporting entity is attacked, this god may give -1 to the attack roll.

name: Hermes
flavor: As a god of athletics and games, Hermes is known as Promachus, meaning "champion".
ability_text: Once per round when this god makes an attack, he may make an additional attack.

name: Bishamonten
credit: Artist unknown, 15th century, photo by Miguelwang2010 / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: As a protector of holy places, Bishamonten is called Tamonten, or "listening to many teachings".
ability_text: When this god is attacked and the attack hits, the attacking entity removes 1 less energy point from him, to a minimum of 1.

name: Izanami
flavor: Izanami rules Yomi, the land of the dead, and is called Yomotsu ōkami, "Grand Deity of Yomi."
ability_text: When this goddess is invoked, she may clash with an opposing entity. If this goddess wins that clash, the opposing entity is defeated.

name: Susanoo
flavor: Susanoo's sword was called Amenohabakiri, which means "Snake-Slayer of Takamagahara".
ability_text: Each round, this god may give +2 to the first defense roll made by a supporting entity.

name: Skaði
flavor: Skaði is called Öndurdís, or "(she) of the snow shoe", because she is associated with winter and hunting.
ability_text: Once per round when an entity makes a roll, this goddess may give -1 to that roll.

name: Sól
flavor: The goddess Sól drives a sun-chariot named Álfröðull, which means "elf disc".
ability_text: When this goddess makes an attack roll, she may use her current energy point total as her Attack score. This goddess may never have more than 9 energy points.

name: Thor
flavor: Thor's hammer can level mountains, and is called Mjölnir, or "that which smashes".
ability_text: Once per round after this god makes an attack, if the attack roll was even, he may make an additional attack.

name: Bau
credit: Artist unknown, ca. 2150 BCE, photo copyright Marie-Lan Nguyen / Wikimedia Commons.
flavor: A goddess of fertility and healing, Bau was the patron deity of the city of Lagash.
ability_text: When this goddess makes an attack and the attack hits, she may give an energy point to any supporting entity.

name: Enki
flavor: Enki is called the lord of the Abzu, the groundwater located within the earth.
ability_text: When this god makes a defense roll, he may use his current energy point total as his Defense score. This god may never have more than 9 energy points.

name: Azathoth
flavor: "Azathoth... gnaws hungrily in inconceivable, unlighted chambers beyond time and space..."
ability_text: When this god removes one or more energy points from an entity in a coalition faction, he may remove an energy point from all other entities in all coalition factions. This god may only battle when Cthulhu Rises.

name: Cthulhu
flavor: "In his house at R'lyeh, dead Cthulhu waits dreaming."
ability_name: High Priest of the Outer Gods
ability_text: When a deity in the outer faction is hit by an attack from an opposing entity, this god clashes with that entity. If this god wins that clash, he removes up to 2 energy points from that entity. This god may only battle when Cthulhu Rises.

name: Father Dagon
credit: Modified, original by Marcel-Henry Favretto / Pixabay, 2012.
flavor: "Vast, Polyphemus-like, and loathsome... like a stupendous monster of nightmares..."
ability_text: When this god first enters the battle, he may summon a Deep One creature. This god cannot be attacked while he is supported by a Deep One. When this god makes an attack, if all of the entities in this god's faction have {OLD_ONES}, the defending entity gets -1 Defense for each Deep One in this god's faction.

name: Hastur
flavor: "[T]his talisman is indeed the nameless Yellow Sign handed down from the accursed cult of Hastur..."
ability_text: While all of the entities in this god's faction have {OLD_ONES}, this god may give them +1 Attack.

name: Hypnos
flavor: "But always I shall guard against the mocking and insatiate Hypnos, lord of sleep..."
ability_text: While all of the entities in this god's faction have {OLD_ONES}, their Defense scores cannot be modified by the abilities of opposing entities.

name: Mother Hydra
flavor: "[G]o back to the Mother Hydra an’ Father Dagon what we all come from..."
ability_text: When an opposing entity attacks a supporting creature and that attack hits, this goddess may immediately attack that opposing entity.

name: Nyarlathotep
flavor: "[T]he blind, voiceless, mindless gargoyles whose soul is Nyarlathotep."
ability_text: When a supporting entity in the outer faction removes one or more energy points from an opposing entity, this god may remove an energy point from that opposing entity. This god may only battle when Cthulhu Rises.

name: Yog-Sothoth
flavor: "He knows where the Old Ones broke through of old, and where They shall break through again."
ability_text: This god may give +2 to all rolls made by the entities in this god's faction. This god may only battle when Cthulhu Rises.

name: Deep One
credit: Modified, original by Ivan Yakovlevich Bilibin, 1934.
flavor: "All in the band of the faithful—Order o’ Dagon—an’ the children shud never die..."
ability_text: When this creature makes an attack, if all of the entities in this creature's faction have {OLD_ONES}, the defending entity gets -1 Defense for each Deep One in this creature's faction.

name: Deep One
credit: Modified, original by Ivan Yakovlevich Bilibin, 1934.
flavor: "All in the band of the faithful—Order o’ Dagon—an’ the children shud never die..."
ability_text: When this creature makes an attack, if all of the entities in this creature's faction have {OLD_ONES}, the defending entity gets -1 Defense for each Deep One in this creature's faction.

name: Deep One
credit: Modified, original by Ivan Yakovlevich Bilibin, 1934.
flavor: "All in the band of the faithful—Order o’ Dagon—an’ the children shud never die..."
ability_text: When this creature makes an attack, if all of the entities in this creature's faction have {OLD_ONES}, the defending entity gets -1 Defense for each Deep One in this creature's faction.

name: Deep One
credit: Modified, original by Ivan Yakovlevich Bilibin, 1934.
flavor: "All in the band of the faithful—Order o’ Dagon—an’ the children shud never die..."
ability_text: When this creature makes an attack, if all of the entities in this creature's faction have {OLD_ONES}, the defending entity gets -1 Defense for each Deep One in this creature's faction.

name: Shoggoth
flavor: "[A] terrible, indescribable thing... with myriads of temporary eyes forming and un-forming..."
ability_text: When this creature removes one or more energy points from an opposing entity, if all of the entities in this creature's faction have {OLD_ONES}, it may remove an additional energy point for each Shoggoth in this creature's faction.

name: Shoggoth
flavor: "[A] terrible, indescribable thing... with myriads of temporary eyes forming and un-forming..."
ability_text: When this creature removes one or more energy points from an opposing entity, if all of the entities in this creature's faction have {OLD_ONES}, it may remove an additional energy point for each Shoggoth in this creature's faction.

name: Shoggoth
flavor: "[A] terrible, indescribable thing... with myriads of temporary eyes forming and un-forming..."
ability_text: When this creature removes one or more energy points from an opposing entity, if all of the entities in this creature's faction have {OLD_ONES}, it may remove an additional energy point for each Shoggoth in this creature's faction.

name: Shoggoth
flavor: "[A] terrible, indescribable thing... with myriads of temporary eyes forming and un-forming..."
ability_text: When this creature removes one or more energy points from an opposing entity, if all of the entities in this creature's faction have {OLD_ONES}, it may remove an additional energy point for each Shoggoth in this creature's faction.

name: Bifröst
flavor: Bifröst is a burning rainbow bridge that reaches between Midgard (the world) and Asgard, the realm of the Norse gods and goddesses.
ability_text: Deities get Attack +2 and have "EMPOWER: Destroy Bifröst and remove 2 energy points from each entity in the battle."

name: Duat
flavor: The Egyptian land of the dead is called the Duat, where the souls of the deceased undergo the final judgment of the "Weighing of the Heart".
ability_text: When an entity would be defeated, that entity may make a die roll. If that roll is even, that entity remains in the battle with 1 energy point. Each entity may only use this ability once per round.

name: Mount Olympus
flavor: Many of the Greek gods and goddesses live on Mount Olympus, which contains the palaces of the gods within its crevasses, as well their meeting place, Pantheon.
ability_text: When an entity loses a clash, remove two energy points from that entity.

name: R'lyeh
credit: Modified, original by Reimund Bertrams / Pixabay, 2014.
flavor: "[H]alf-seen columns of unsanctified temples that rest on nameless rocks beneath space and reach up to dizzy vacua above the spheres of light and darkness."
ability_text: Entities with {CHAOS} or {OLD_ONES} cannot be defeated by any entity's ability.

name: Asteroid Impact
ability_text: This intervention may only be used immediately after an attack hits. Remove up to 2 energy points from an opposing entity.

name: Avalanche
ability_text: This intervention may only be used immediately after an opposing entity makes a defense or clash roll. That roll gets -2.

name: Blizzard
ability_text: This intervention may only be used immediately after an opposing faction uses an intervention. That intervention is discarded, and its effects are nullified.

name: Drought
ability_text: This intervention may only be used immediately after an entity in this faction is attacked and the attack hits. No energy may be removed as a result of that attack.

name: Firestorm
ability_text: This intervention may only be used immediately after an attack hits. An entity in this faction may immediately make an attack.

name: Ice Storm
ability_text: This intervention may only be used immediately after a defense roll is made. That roll gets either +2 or -2.

name: Maelstrom
ability_text: This intervention may only be used immediately after an entity in this faction makes an attack and the attack misses. Remove up to 2 energy points from an opposing entity.

name: Sunblast
ability_text: This intervention may only be used immediately after an attack roll is made. That roll gets either +2 or -2.

name: Tsunami
ability_text: This intervention may only be used immediately after an entity in this faction makes an attack or clash roll. That roll gets +2.

name: Volcanic Blast
ability_text: This intervention may only be used immediately after an entity in this faction is defeated. Remove up to 3 energy points from an opposing entity.

name: Wildfire
ability_text: This intervention may only be used immediately after an entity in this faction is attacked and the attack hits. Remove up to 2 energy points from the attacking entity.

name: Prometheus
flavor: Prometheus was said to have stolen fire from the gods and given it to humans, earning the wrath of Zeus.
ability_text: Deities with {FIRE} have no abilities.

name: Cthulhu
flavor: "That is not dead which can eternal lie. And with strange aeons even death may die."
ability_text: When this god is invoked, and at the start of each round, this god may clash with an opposing entity. When this god wins a clash, he may remove an energy point from an opposing entity.
